A **tsurugi** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a two-handed weapon that uses the [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), and appears as a **long samurai sword** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification"). It is made of [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal").

The tsurugi is the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for [the Tsurugi of Muramasa](/wiki/The_Tsurugi_of_Muramasa "The Tsurugi of Muramasa"), which the former's [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry alludes to.

[ ]

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Tsurugi are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for and appear in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"). The Tsurugi of Muramasa will revert to a plain tsurugi if found in a bones file by a Samurai character.

## Strategy

Though tsurugi do even more damage than ordinary two-handed swords, they are subject to [the same disadvantages](/wiki/Two-handed_weapon#Wielding_cursed_two-handers "Two-handed weapon"). Any role that is unrestricted in two-handed swords can also [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), and there are weapon combinations that can do more damage than an ordinary tsurugi.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 60c19568](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/60c1956850179f4860e59957138154ec65255998), two-handed weapons gain a 1⁄2 [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") bonus when used in melee.

## History

The tsurugi first appears in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Tsurugi (sword)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsurugi_\(sword\) "wikipedia:Tsurugi (sword)")***

A tsurugi is a Japanese straight-bladed, double-edged sword, making it easy to distinguish from the curved [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana").

[Kusanagi](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kusanagi "wikipedia:Kusanagi"), one of the three Imperial Regalia of Japan, is said to be a tsurugi.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), monsters that are huge or bigger in size can wield a tsurugi in one hand.

The [ogre emperor](/wiki/Ogre_emperor "Ogre emperor") always generates with a tsurugi that will be at least +1.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a tsurugi can be created by combining a katana and a two-handed sword at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), tsurugi are popular two-weapon candidates for [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") characters, who can wield two-handed weapons in one hand and even [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") with them.

A tsurugi can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a katana and a two-handed sword.

## Encyclopedia entry

The tsurugi, also known as the long samurai sword, is an  
 extremely sharp, two-handed blade favored by the samurai.  
 It is made of hardened steel, and is manufactured using a  
 special process, causing it to never rust. The tsurugi is  
 rumored to be so sharp that it can occasionally cut  
 opponents in half!
